reference.scope: X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (1.6 ANGSTROMS) OF 163-187 IN COMPLEX WITH ANTIBODY

comment.text: B-lymphocyte-specific membrane protein that plays a role in the regulation of cellular calcium influx necessary for the development, differentiation, and activation of B-lymphocytes (PubMed:3925015, PubMed:7684739, PubMed:12920111). Functions as a store-operated calcium (SOC) channel component promoting calcium influx after activation by the B-cell receptor/BCR (PubMed:7684739, PubMed:12920111, PubMed:18474602).
Forms homotetramers (PubMed:7684739, PubMed:18474602). Interacts with the heavy and light chains of cell surface IgM, the antigen-binding components of the BCR (PubMed:18474602).
Phosphorylated on serines and threonines in resting B-cells. Protein kinase C/PKC can use CD20 as substrate.

disease.name: Immunodeficiency, common variable, 5
disease.description: A primary immunodeficiency characterized by antibody deficiency, hypogammaglobulinemia, recurrent bacterial infections and an inability to mount an antibody response to antigen. The defect results from a failure of B-cell differentiation and impaired secretion of immunoglobulins; the numbers of circulating B-cells is usually in the normal range, but can be low.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

Monoclonal antibodies (mAb) against CD20 are used to treat B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL). These antibodies include Rituximab (Mabthera), Britumomab (Zevalin) and Tositumomab (Bexxar). CD20 engaged by mAb can generate transmembrane signals capable of directly controlling cell growth and triggering cell death in certain tumors. Alternatively, mAb can mediate complement-dependent cytotoxicity.
Epitope 1, mapped in PubMed:16785532, is predicted to be buried in the membrane. Its accessibility to the extracellular space, and thus to antibody recognition, is not explained.

property.value: Expressed in blood and 158 other tissues
F:MHC class II protein complex binding

feature.description: Abrogates recognition by some antibodies; when associated with D-163 and D-166. Slight decrease of rituximab binding; when associated with D-163 and D-166.
Decreased binding of some antibodies. No effect on rituximab binding.
Decreased binding of some antibodies. No effect on rituximab binding.
Abrogates recognition by therapeutic antibodies, including rituximab; when associated with S-172.
Marked reduction in rituximab binding. Abrogates recognition by antibodies, including rituximab; when associated with S-170.
